questiontext.text:
Exercise

In the design of orifice plate flowmeters, the volumetric flowrate, \(Q\) \((\textrm{m}^{2}\textrm{s}^{-1})\), is given by \[Q = CO\sqrt{\dfrac{2g\Delta h}{1 - O^{2}/P^{2}}}\] where \(C\) is a dimensionless discharge coefficient, \(\Delta h \textrm{ (m)}\) is the head difference across the orifice plate and \(O\) \((\textrm{m}^{2})\) is the area of the orifice and \(P\) \((\textrm{m}^{2})\) is the area of the pipe.


  1. Rearrange the equation to solve for the area of the orifice, \(O\), in terms of the other variables \(O =\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

  2. A volumetric flowrate of {@aq*10^6@} \(\textrm{cm}^{3}\textrm{s}^{-1}\) passes through a {@diam*100@} \(\textrm{cm}\) inside diameter pipe. Assuming a discharge coefficient of {@float(ac)@}, calculate the required orifice diameter, so that the head difference across the orifice plate is {@ah*1000@} \(\textrm{mm}\).

    (Give your answer as a decimal to three decimal places, note that trailing zeroes are required i.e. \(2.3\) must be written as \(2.300\).)

    Orifice diameter = [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]]

    [[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. We have the equation \[Q = CO\sqrt{\dfrac{2g\Delta h}{1-O^{2}/P^{2}}}\] First divide by \(CO\) \[\implies \dfrac{Q}{CO} = \sqrt{\dfrac{2g\Delta h}{1-O^{2}/P^{2}}}\] Square both sides \[\implies \dfrac{Q^{2}}{C^{2}O^{2}} = \dfrac{2g\Delta h}{1-O^{2}/P^{2}}\] Multiply through by \((1-O^{2}/P^{2})\), expand out the brackets and simplify \[\implies \dfrac{Q^{2}}{C^{2}O^{2}}(1-O^{2}/P^{2}) = 2g\Delta h \implies \dfrac{Q^{2}}{C^{2}O^{2}}-\dfrac{Q^{2}}{C^{2}O^{2}}(\dfrac{O^{2}}{P^{2}}) = 2g\Delta h \implies \dfrac{Q^{2}}{C^{2}O^{2}}-\dfrac{Q^{2}}{C^{2}P^{2}} = 2g\Delta h\] Multiply through by \(C^2P^2\) \[\implies \dfrac{Q^{2}P^{2}}{O^2}-Q^2 = 2g\Delta hC^{2}P^{2}\] Add \(Q^2\) to both sides \[\implies \dfrac{Q^{2}P^{2}}{O^2} = Q^2+2g\Delta hC^{2}P^{2}\] Multiply by \(O^2\) \[\implies Q^{2}P^{2} = O^2(Q^2+2g\Delta hC^{2}P^{2})\] Divide by \((Q^2+2g\Delta hC^{2}P^{2})\) \[\implies O^2 = \dfrac{Q^{2}P^{2}}{Q^2+2g\Delta hC^{2}P^{2}}\] We then take the square root of both sides of the equation \[\implies \sqrt{O^2} = \sqrt{\dfrac{Q^{2}P^{2}}{Q^2+2g\Delta hC^{2}P^{2}}}\] Since Q, O and A take positive values this can be simplified to transpose the equation in terms of \(O\) \[\implies O = \dfrac{QP}{\sqrt{Q^2+2g\Delta hC^{2}P^{2}}}\]
  2. We first need to convert these input values so to SI units.

    \(Q = {@aq*10^6@} \textrm{ cm}^{3}\textrm{s}^{-1} = {@dispsf(float(aq),1)@} \textrm{ m}^{3}\textrm{s}^{-1}\)

    diameter of pipe \(= {@diam*100@} \textrm{ cm} = {@float(diam)@} \textrm{ m} \implies P = \pi \dfrac{{@float(diam)@}^2}{4} = {@dispsf(float(ap),4)@}...\textrm{ m}\)

    \(C = {@float(ac)@}\)

    \(\Delta h = {@ah*1000@} \textrm{ mm} = {@float(ah)@} \textrm{ m}\)

    \(g = 9.81 \textrm{ m}\textrm{s}^{-2}\)


    We can now substitute these values into our equation for \(O\) \[O = \dfrac{QP}{\sqrt{Q^2+2g\Delta hC^{2}P^{2}}} = \dfrac{{@dispsf(float(aq),1)@}\cdot {@dispsf(float(ap),4)@}...}{\sqrt{{@dispsf(float(aq),1)@}^2+2\cdot 9.81\cdot {@float(ah)@}\cdot {@float(ac)@}^{2}\cdot ({@dispsf(float(ap),4)@}...)^{2}}} = {@ta2w@}\] To finally get the orifice diameter from this value we transpose the formula for the area of a circle \(\text{area} = \pi \cdot (\dfrac{diameter}{2})^2\) to get \[\text{orifice diameter} = 2 \sqrt{\dfrac{O}{\pi}} = 2 \sqrt{\dfrac{{@ta2w@}}{\pi}} = {@ta2@}\]

questionvariables.text:
stack_unit_si_declare(true); eqn: C*O*((2*g*h)/(1-(O^2/P^2)))
ta1: (Q*P)/sqrt(Q^2+2*g*h*C^2*P^2)
aq: rand([1/10000,1/5000]) diam: rand([1/10,1/5]) ap: %pi*((diam/2)^2) ah: rand([1/5,2/5]) ac: rand([6/10,8/10])
eqnd: sqrt((4/%pi)*((Q*P)/sqrt(Q^2+2*g*h*C^2*P^2))) ta2: stackunits(dispsf(float(ev(eqnd,Q=aq,P=ap,g=981/1000,h=ah,C=ac)),3), m) ta2w: stackunits(dispsf(float(ev(ta1,Q=aq,P=ap,g=981/1000,h=ah,C=ac)),3), m^2)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

truefeedback.text: You have correctly substituted the inputs into your equation for part (a) however because your part (a) is wrong this is also not the correct answer.
